_documentation.version_control: This field tracks the version of the assessment template
_documentation.structure_overview: This template defines the structure for all assessments in the system

question_rules.scoring: Scores must range from 1-5, where 1 is most positive
question_rules.categories: Each question must have a category and contribute to primaryCategory

recommendation_rules.levels: Must include: very-high, high, medium, low, very-low
recommendation_rules.format: Use lowercase with hyphens for all recommendation levels

threshold_rules.labels: Must use consistent labels: very-high, high, medium, low, very-low
threshold_rules.displayText: Each threshold must have a user-friendly displayText

specific_recommendations.title: Must be 'Specific Recommendations'
specific_recommendations.icon: Must be a valid icon name

general_recommendations.title: Must be 'General Recommendations'
general_recommendations.icon: Must be a valid icon name

naming.categories: Use Title Case for category names (e.g., 'Stress Management')
naming.recommendations: Use lowercase with hyphens for recommendation levels
naming.results_sections: Use consistent titles: 'Specific Recommendations' and 'General Recommendations'

content.options: Ensure options are mutually exclusive and cover the full range
content.results_sections: Keep section titles consistent across all assessments

scoring.consistency: Maintain consistent scoring across all questions
scoring.direction: 1 is always the most positive/desired response
scoring.categories: Each question should contribute to both its category and primaryCategory

common_pitfalls: Don't mix case styles in recommendation levels
Ensure all placeholder text is replaced

complete_question.text: How do your leaders typically respond to unexpected changes or disruptions?

options.text: Often resist change and struggle to adapt plans
Accept change reluctantly but have difficulty adjusting strategies
Adapt to change adequately but could improve flexibility
Generally embrace change and adjust plans accordingly
View change as opportunity and quickly pivot strategies when needed

base: Focus on developing an agile mindset before implementing specific practices
Build a culture of psychological safety to enable experimentation
Ensure leaders model the behaviors they wish to see in their teams
very-high: Implement a comprehensive agile leadership development program
Establish regular leadership retrospectives to drive continuous improvement
Create clear metrics for measuring leadership effectiveness in agility
Partner leaders with agile coaches for personalized development

needLevel.label: very-high
needLevel.displayText: There is a very high chance your team could benefit from agile leadership training

needLevel.label: high
needLevel.displayText: There is a high chance your team could benefit from agile leadership training

scorecardInfo.title: Agile Leadership Metrics
scorecardInfo.shortDescription: Evaluate your organization's agile leadership capabilities and identify improvement opportunities

update_instructions.new_scorecard: 1. Copy the complete_scorecard example. 2. Update all fields with your specific values. 3. Ensure the id is unique and in kebab-case. 4. Add the scorecard to the scorecards array.
update_instructions.update_scorecard: 1. Locate the existing scorecard in the scorecards array. 2. Update the relevant fields while maintaining the structure. 3. Ensure all required fields are present. 4. Verify the id remains unchanged.
update_instructions.validation: After creating or updating a scorecard, verify: 1. All required fields are present. 2. The id is unique and properly formatted. 3. The title and category use Title Case. 4. The visibility field is a boolean.

test_sync: This field should be added to all JSONs
_setup_instructions: IMPORTANT SETUP INSTRUCTIONS: 1. Replace all placeholder values marked with ${...}. 2. For each question in your assessment, add a corresponding category in questionRecommendations. 3. Ensure primaryCategory is set to your main scoring category. 4. Use the question's category name exactly as it appears in the questions section. 5. Each question should contribute to both its own category score and the primaryCategory score. 6. The paths in nextRoute should include the assessment ID (e.g., '/survey/your-assessment-id'). 7. Remove this _setup_instructions field when done.
_question_standardization: QUESTION STANDARDIZATION RULES: 1. All assessments must have exactly 12 questions. 2. All questions must be in English. 3. Question scoring follows this pattern: a) Each question has 5 options. b) Options are scored from 1 to 5, where 1 is the most positive/desired response and 5 is the least positive/desired response. c) Each option contributes to both its specific category score and the primaryCategory score. d) The scoring should be consistent across all questions in the assessment.

intro.title: Innovation Capability Assessment
intro.subtitle: Evaluate your organization's innovation readiness and identify improvement opportunities

instructions.title: How to Complete This Assessment
steps: Answer each question based on observed organizational practices
Consider patterns across different departments and teams
Focus on innovation processes and outcomes
Select the option that best reflects current capabilities

columns.title: Innovation Framework
columns.content: Measuring and enhancing organizational innovation capabilities

points.description: How well the organization supports creative thinking
Effectiveness of idea generation to implementation

intro.consentText: I understand this assessment will help identify areas for improving innovation capabilities

items.text: How would you describe your organization's approach to new ideas?

options.text: New ideas are rarely encouraged or implemented
New ideas are considered but rarely acted upon
Some new ideas are supported with limited resources
New ideas are often encouraged and sometimes implemented
New ideas are actively sought, supported, and implemented

items.text: How structured is your innovation process from idea to implementation?

options.text: We have no defined process for developing innovations
Our innovation process is informal and inconsistent
We have basic processes but they're not always followed
We have defined processes that are usually followed
We have well-established, effective innovation processes

items.text: How does your organization allocate resources for innovation?

options.text: Very limited resources are available for innovation
Resources are available but difficult to access
Some resources are available for selected initiatives
Resources are generally available for promising ideas
Dedicated resources are readily available for innovation

items.text: How effectively does your organization measure and track innovation outcomes?

options.text: We don't measure innovation outcomes
We track basic metrics inconsistently
We have some metrics but lack comprehensive tracking
We regularly track key innovation metrics
We have comprehensive innovation measurement systems

items.text: How does your organization handle failure in innovation attempts?

options.text: Failure is severely punished or criticized
Failure is generally viewed negatively
Some tolerance for failure but with consequences
Failure is accepted as part of innovation
Failure is viewed as a learning opportunity

items.text: How does your organization collaborate on innovation initiatives?

options.text: Very little collaboration across teams or departments
Occasional collaboration but mostly siloed work
Some cross-functional collaboration on key projects
Regular collaboration across most innovation initiatives
Strong culture of collaboration and knowledge sharing

items.text: How does your organization develop innovation capabilities in employees?

options.text: No formal innovation training or development
Limited ad-hoc training opportunities
Some training programs but not comprehensive
Regular innovation training and development
Comprehensive innovation capability development

items.text: How does your organization's innovation performance compare to competitors?

options.text: We significantly lag behind competitors
We are somewhat behind most competitors
We are on par with industry average
We are ahead of most competitors
We are recognized as an innovation leader

items.text: How does your organization encourage creative thinking and idea generation?

options.text: Creative thinking is not encouraged or supported
Limited opportunities for creative thinking
Some structured brainstorming sessions
Regular ideation sessions and creative workshops
Continuous creative thinking embedded in daily work

items.text: How does your organization manage the transition from idea to implementation?

options.text: No structured process for idea implementation
Ad-hoc implementation with frequent delays
Basic implementation process with some gaps
Structured implementation with regular reviews
Efficient, well-defined implementation process

items.text: How does your organization balance innovation with day-to-day operations?

options.text: No dedicated time or resources for innovation
Limited resources available for innovation
Some resources allocated but often diverted
Balanced allocation between operations and innovation
Strategic resource allocation for innovation

items.text: How does your organization measure the success of innovation initiatives?

options.text: No measurement of innovation success
Basic metrics without clear targets
Some success metrics but inconsistent tracking
Comprehensive metrics with regular review
Advanced measurement of innovation impact

_scoring_notes.primaryCategory: This is the main category used for overall assessment scoring
_scoring_notes.recommendations: Recommendations are organized by need level
_scoring_notes.thresholds: Thresholds determine the recommendation level based on scores
_scoring_notes.results_sections: Keep section titles consistent: 'Specific Recommendations' and 'General Recommendations'

base: Establish a common language and understanding of innovation across your organization
Encourage experimentation and an appropriate level of risk-taking
Create opportunities for cross-functional collaboration on innovation initiatives
very-high: Develop a comprehensive innovation strategy aligned with your business objectives
Implement an innovation governance structure with clear roles and processes
Design and launch a formal innovation training program for all employees
Create dedicated time and resources for innovation activities
high: Conduct an innovation capability workshop to identify specific barriers and opportunities
Establish innovation metrics and KPIs to track progress and impact
Launch focused innovation initiatives in high-priority business areas
Develop a framework for evaluating and selecting innovation ideas
medium: Enhance existing innovation processes with best practices from leading organizations
Refine your approach to ideation and concept development
Create more effective methods for testing and validating new ideas
Build stronger connections between innovation efforts and business outcomes
low: Fine-tune your innovation ecosystem to optimize resource allocation
Improve connections between different innovation initiatives across the organization
Develop more sophisticated approaches to scaling successful innovations
Create advanced innovation training for innovation leaders and champions
very-low: Establish your organization as an innovation thought leader in your industry
Develop next-generation innovation methodologies tailored to your specific context
Create formal mechanisms to share innovation best practices with others
Explore cutting-edge innovation approaches like open innovation and ecosystem innovation

primary_category.title: Innovation Capability Overview
primary_category.description: Assessment of organizational innovation readiness and effectiveness

secondary_category.title: Innovation Implementation
secondary_category.description: Assessment of organization's ability to execute and implement innovative ideas

high: Significant gaps in innovation implementation processes
Limited success in bringing new ideas to market
medium: Moderate implementation capabilities with some successes
low: Consistent track record of bringing ideas to fruition

high: Develop stage-gate process for innovation development

report_structure.title: Innovation Capability Development Plan
report_structure.description: Based on your innovation assessment, we've created a targeted development plan focused on enhancing innovation capabilities:

critical_focus.title: Critical Innovation Areas
critical_focus.description: These areas require immediate attention based on your assessment:

development_opportunities.title: Development Areas
development_opportunities.description: Areas showing potential for capability enhancement:

implementation_strategy.title: Implementation Strategy
implementation_strategy.description: A structured approach to developing innovation capabilities:
recommendations: Capability Assessment: Document current innovation practices
Resource Allocation: Align resources with innovation goals

support_resources.title: Support Resources
support_resources.description: Tools and resources for innovation development:

Category Name.high: ${Replace with high priority recommendation for this category}
Category Name.medium: ${Replace with medium priority recommendation for this category}
Category Name.low: ${Replace with low priority recommendation for this category}

Another Category.high: ${Replace with high priority recommendation for this category}
Another Category.medium: ${Replace with medium priority recommendation for this category}
Another Category.low: ${Replace with low priority recommendation for this category}

Innovation Culture.high: Establish comprehensive innovation culture program with focus on creativity and risk-taking.
Innovation Culture.medium: Enhance current innovation practices and strengthen creative environment.
Innovation Culture.low: Fine-tune innovation culture and scale successful practices.

Innovation Process.high: Implement structured innovation process from ideation to implementation.
Innovation Process.medium: Strengthen existing innovation processes and improve efficiency.
Innovation Process.low: Optimize innovation processes and share best practices.

Resource Allocation.high: Develop comprehensive resource allocation strategy for innovation.
Resource Allocation.medium: Enhance resource utilization for innovation initiatives.
Resource Allocation.low: Fine-tune resource allocation and maximize innovation impact.

Innovation Outcomes.high: Implement comprehensive innovation measurement and tracking system.
Innovation Outcomes.medium: Enhance existing innovation metrics and reporting.
Innovation Outcomes.low: Optimize innovation outcome tracking and analysis.

needLevel.label: There is a very high chance your team could benefit from innovation capability training
There is a high chance your team could benefit from innovation capability training
There is a moderate chance your team could benefit from innovation capability training
There is a low chance your team could benefit from innovation capability training
There is a very low chance your team could benefit from innovation capability training

summaries.text: Your organization shows significant opportunities for improving innovation capabilities.
Your assessment indicates several areas requiring focused innovation development.
Your organization demonstrates moderate innovation capabilities with room for enhancement.
Your organization shows good innovation practices with opportunities for optimization.
Your organization demonstrates strong innovation capabilities across most areas.

thankYou.title: Thank You for Completing the Innovation Capability Assessment!
thankYou.message: We've analyzed your organization's innovation capabilities and will provide targeted recommendations for improvement.
thankYou.nextSteps: We'll provide detailed insights and actionable recommendations based on your assessment. An innovation specialist may contact you to discuss development strategies.

scorecardInfo.title: Conflict Views
scorecardInfo.shortDescription: Evaluate if your team would benefit from conflict resolution training and mediation techniques
